content: Yes, massages can help manage symptoms of mental health conditions such as anxiety or depression. Massage therapy has been found to be effective in reducing stress and anxiety levels, promoting relaxation, improving sleep, and reducing muscle tension and pain, all of which can help ease symptoms of depression and anxiety. It has also been found to increase the levels of serotonin and dopamine, which are neurotransmitters that play a role in regulating mood and emotions. However, it's important to note that massages should not be used as a substitute for professional treatment and it's important to seek medical advice before trying any new treatment for mental health conditions.
